human x chromosome. essentially humans and kangaroos have the same set of 20,000 genes, said Jenny Graves , but the differences lie in the sequences of those genes and when in development they are turned on and off. kangaroos are a marvellous model for studying human development and reproduction because they are born very early and complete much of their development in the pouch- rather than the womb, said the university of melbourne's Marilyn Renfree who is taking over as kango director from today. receive regular updates highlighting the latest in science from cosmos. draft sequence of kangaroo genome mapped in full" class=
